#Text=Cut Vinyl
#Text=Vinyl is a great crafting material that you can use to create your own custom designs to apply to t-shirts , windows , and just about anything else .
#Text=Cutting vinyl is actually easier than you might think .
#Text=To cut a design or image out of vinyl , you ’ll need an electronic cutting machine .
#Text=But you can also cut simple shapes out of vinyl paper with scissors or a craft knife .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Using an Electronic Cutting Machine
#Text=Get an electronic cutting machine if you do n't already have one .
#Text=Vinyl cutting machines like a Cricut or a Silhouette are easy to load vinyl paper into and simple to operate .
#Text=They work by using software on a computer connected to the machine to design and size images that can then be printed and cut on the vinyl paper loaded in the machine .
#Text=You can purchase electronic cutting machines at craft stores or online .
#Text=Use the cutting machine software to prepare your design .
#Text=The first thing you need to do when you ’re cutting vinyl with a machine is
#Text=make sure the design file is ready to be used by your cutting machine .

#Text=Different cutting machines may require different types of digital files to print and cut your design , so you need to make sure that your cut file is set up so it ’s compatible with your machine .
#Text=Most machines accept SVG files , . studio , . png , . dxf , or . jpeg file types .
#Text=If you ’re not sure , check the owner ’s manual of your cutting machine .
#Text=Make sure the design is scaled to the size you want .
#Text=Place the vinyl paper onto the cutting mat with the backing-side down .
#Text=Put your adhesive vinyl paper onto the mat with the color side facing up and smooth out any wrinkles or bubbles with your hands .
#Text=If your vinyl is on a roll , cut off a piece that fits onto the cutting mat .
#Text=Adjust the cut settings for the type of vinyl you are using .
#Text=Use your cutting software to choose the type of vinyl you ’re using .
#Text=Different types of vinyl may require different settings in order for your machine to effectively cut the material .
#Text=For example , glitter vinyl will require different cut settings than glossy vinyl .
#Text=Load the cutting mat and cut the vinyl .
#Text=Insert the cutting mat where it ’s indicated on your machine and make sure it ’s properly attached and wo n’t fall out .
#Text=Use your cutting software to start the machine and cut the vinyl .
#Text=Do not interrupt or touch the vinyl while it ’s being cut .
#Text=Use a weeding hook to remove any excess vinyl .
#Text=“ Weeding ” is the process of removing the excess vinyl around your design so you ’re left with just the cut vinyl .
#Text=Use a weeding hook and pry up and remove the vinyl surrounding your design .
#Text=You can purchase weeding hooks online or at your local craft or hobby store .
#Text=If you ca n’t see the cut lines in the vinyl , try gently bending it so they ’ll separate a little and you can see them better .
#Text=Apply the vinyl design .
#Text=Remove the adhesive backing and place one end of the vinyl on the surface .
#Text=Apply the vinyl slowly and smooth it out with your fingers as you go .
#Text=Once the vinyl has been attached , apply firm pressure and use your hands to rub the vinyl so the adhesive binds with the surface .
#Text=Cutting by Hand
#Text=Use scissors to cut simple shapes out of your vinyl paper .
#Text=Cutting vinyl by hand makes it difficult to cut intricate shapes out of adhesive vinyl paper , so it ’s best to stick to basic shapes like triangles and squares .
#Text=Take a pair of scissors and cut out some shapes from your adhesive vinyl paper .
#Text=Use a craft knife if you 're trying to cut out intricate designs .
#Text=You can trace a design onto vinyl paper and use a sharp craft knife to cut it out .
#Text=Lay the vinyl paper on a cutting surface with the adhesive backing down .
#Text=Apply pressure with the knife to cut through the paper and then remove your cut design by separating it along the cut lines .
#Text=Be very careful when using a craft knife as the blade is very sharp .
#Text=Apply the vinyl to your surface .
#Text=When you have enough shapes cut out of your vinyl that you want to use , peel off the sticky backing of the vinyl and place one end of the vinyl on the surface you want to attach it to .
#Text=Gently apply the rest of the sticky paper to the surface and smooth it out with your fingers as you go .
#Text=Use your hands to push out any bubbles or wrinkles that form in the vinyl .
#Text=Hold pressure on the vinyl shape for 10 seconds .
#Text=To make sure the vinyl fully adheres to the surface , use your hands to apply firm pressure and hold it for about 10 seconds .
#Text=Then slowly release the pressure .
#Text=Things You ’ll Need
#Text=Using an Electronic Cutting Machine
#Text=Electronic cutting machine
#Text=Vinyl paper
#Text=Weeding hook
#Text=Cutting mat
#Text=Cutting by Hand
#Text=Scissors or craft knife
#Text=Vinyl paper
